Catalogue.Scope: Features, attributes, enumerations and feature-attribute bindings for the use in Inland ENCs

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Beacon shape
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: The beacon shape describes the characteristic geometric form of the beacon.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: stake, pole, perch, post
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an elongated wood or metal pole, embedded in the bottom to serve as a navigational aid or a support for a navigational aid. (adapted from IHO Dictionary S-32, 5th Edition, 4960)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: pile beacon
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a long heavy timber(s) or section(s) of steel, wood, concrete, etc., forced into the seabed to serve as an aid to navigation or as a support for an aid to navigation.(Adapted from IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 3840 and Navigation Dictionary, US National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration - NOAA, 1969)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Buoy shape
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: The principal shapes are those recommended in the International Association of Lighthouse Authorities - IALA System.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: conical (nun, ogival)
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: the upper part of the body above the water-line, or the greater part of the superstructure, has approximately the shape or the appearance of a pointed cone with the point upwards.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: can (cylindrical)
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: the upper part of the body above the water-line, or the greater part of the superstructure, has the shape of a cylinder, or a truncated cone that approximates to a cylinder, with a flat end uppermost.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: spherical
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: the upper part of the body above the water-line, or the greater part of the superstructure, has the shape of a part of a sphere.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: pillar
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: the upper part of the body above the water-line, or the greater part of the superstructure is a narrow vertical structure, pillar or lattice tower.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: spar (spindle)
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: the upper part of the body above the water-line, or the greater part of the superstructure, has the form of a pole, or of a very long cylinder, floating upright.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: barrel (tun)
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: the upper part of the body above the water-line, or the greater part of the superstructure, has the form of a barrel or cylinder floating horizontally.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: ice buoy
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a specially constructed shuttle shaped buoy which is used in ice conditions.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Buried depth
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The depth below the sea bed to which an object is buried.
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: The unit of measure is defined in the HUNI subfield of the DSPM record or in the HUNITS attribute of the M_UNIT meta object class, e.g., metre (m). The resolution is 0.1 m or 0.1 ft.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: military aeroplane airport
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a large military airfield usually equipped with a control tower, hangars and accommodation for the receiving and discharging of passengers or cargo. (adapted from The Macquarie Dictionary, 1988)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: civil aeroplane airport
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a large airfield usually equipped with a control tower, hangars and accommodation for the receiving and discharging of passengers or cargo. (The Macquarie Dictionary, 1988)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: small planes airfield
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an area of land set aside for the take-off and landing of small aeroplanes.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: fixed bridge
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a bridge having permanent horizontal and vertical alignment. (McGraw-Hill Dictionary of Scientific and Technical Terms, 3rd Edition, 1984)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: swing bridge
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a movable bridge (or span thereof) which rotates in a horizontal plane about a vertical pivot to allow the passage of vessels. (adapted from McGraw-Hill Encyclopaedia of Science and Technology, 7th Edition, 1992)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: lifting bridge
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a movable bridge (or span thereof) which is capable of being lifted vertically to allow vessels to pass beneath. (adapted from IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 547)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: bascule bridge
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a counterpoise bridge rotated in a vertical plane about an axis at one or both ends. Also called a balance. (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 545)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: suspension bridge
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a fixed bridge consisting of either a roadway or a truss suspended from two or more cables which pass over towers and are anchored by backstays to a firm foundation. (McGraw-Hill Encyclopaedia of Science and Technology, 7th Edition, 1992)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: urban area
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an area predominantly occupied by man-made structures used for residential, commercial, and industrial purposes. (Nautical Chart Manual, US Department of Commerce, 1992)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: settlement
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a small collection of dwellings in a remote area.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: village
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a collection of houses in a rural district, usually smaller than a town.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: town
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: any considerable collection of dwellings and other buildings larger than a village, but not incorporated as a city.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: city
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a major town inhabited by a large permanent community with all essential services.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: power line
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a cable used for the supply of electricity.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: transmission line
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: multiple un-insulated cables usually supported by steel lattice towers. Such features are generally more prominent than normal power lines.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: telephone
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a cable used for the transmission of telephone signals.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: telegraph
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a cable used for the transmission of telegraph signals.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: mooring cable/chain
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a cable or chain used to secure a mooring buoy or other floating structure.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Category of cardinal mark
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: Cardinal marks do not have a distinctive shape but are normally pillar or spar. They are always painted in yellow and black horizontal bands and their distinctive double cone top-marks are always black. (Note that such top-marks are encoded as separate TOPMAR objects). Cardinal marks may also have a special system of flashing white lights and if such lights are fitted they are encoded as separate LIGHTS objects.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: north cardinal mark
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: Quadrant bounded by the true bearing NW-NE taken from the point of interest it should be passed to the north side of the mark.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: east cardinal mark
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: Quadrant bounded by the true bearing NE-SE taken from the point of interest it should be passed to the east side of the mark.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: south cardinal mark
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: Quadrant bounded by the true bearing SE-SW taken from the point of interest it should be passed to the south side of the mark.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: west cardinal mark
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: Quadrant bounded by the true bearing SW-NW taken from the point of interest it should be passed to the west side of the mark.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: belt conveyor
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a conveyor along which material or people are transported by means of a moving belt.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: coverage available
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: continuous coverage of spatial objects is available within this area.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: no coverage available
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an area containing no spatial objects.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: container crane/gantry
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a high speed, shore-based crane used in the lift-on/lift-off operation of specially constructed containers. (adapted from Nautical Chart Manual, US Department of Commerce, Coast and Geodetic Survey, 7th Edition)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: weir
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a dam erected across a river to raise the level of the water. A fence of stakes set in a river or along the shore as a trap for fish.
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: The word is now restricted to smaller works, the larger are called dams.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: dam
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a barrier to check or confine anything in motion; particularly one constructed to hold back water and raise its level to form a reservoir, or to prevent flooding. (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 1196)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: distance mark not physically installed
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a point at which a distance from an origin along a feature is given for information, but at which no specific marker exists.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: visible mark, pole
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a point at which a distance from an origin along a feature is given for information and which is marked by a pole.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: visible mark, board
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a point at which a distance from an origin along a feature is given for information and which is marked by a board.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: visible mark, unknown shape
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a point at which a distance from an origin along a feature is given for information and which is physically marked, but the shape of the mark is not known or not given.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: fence
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a man made barrier used as an enclosure or boundary or for protection. (Digital Geographic Information Working Group -DGIWG, Oct. 1987)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: wall
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a fence constructed from masonry or stone.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Category of fog signal
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: The classification 'horn' is the generic term for fog signals 'nautophone', 'reed' and 'tyfon'.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: explosive
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a signal produced by the firing of explosive charges. (Admiralty List of Lights and Fog Signals)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: diaphone
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a diaphone uses compressed air and generally emits a powerful low-pitched sound, which often concludes with a brief sound of suddenly lowered pitch, termed the 'grunt'. (Admiralty List of Lights and Fog Signals)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: siren
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a siren uses compressed air and exists in a variety of types which differ considerably in their sound and power. (Admiralty List of Lights and Fog Signals)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: nautophone
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a horn having a diaphragm oscillated by electricity (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 3371).

DataDictionaryReference.Name: reed
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a reed uses compressed air and emits a weak, high pitched sound. (Admiralty List of Lights and Fog Signals)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: tyfon
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a diaphragm horn which operates under the influence of compressed air or steam (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 5717).

DataDictionaryReference.Name: bell
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a ringing sound with a short range. The apparatus may be operated automatically, by hand or by wave action. (IHO Chart Specifications, M-4, 452.5)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: whistle
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a distinctive sound made by a jet of air passing through an orifice. The apparatus may be operated automatically, by hand or by air being forced up a tube by waves acting on a buoy. (IHO Chart Specifications, M-4, 452.6)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: gong
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a sound produced by vibration of a disc when struck. The apparatus may be operated automatically, by hand or by wave action. (IHO Chart Specifications, M-4, 452.7)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: horn
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a horn uses compressed air or electricity to vibrate a diaphragm and exists in a variety of types which differ greatly in their sound and power. (Admiralty List of Lights and Fog Signals)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Category of ferry
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: The value 'cable ferry' indicates a ferry that follows a fixed route guided by a cable. A cable ferry may hinder the flow of other traffic.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: 'free-moving' ferry
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a ferry which may have routes that vary with weather, tide and traffic. (adapted from M-4)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: cable ferry
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a ferry that follows a fixed route guided by a cable. (adapted from IHO Specifications, M-4)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: lock gate
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: lock gates are the massive hinged doors at each end of a lock. (adapted from IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 2882)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Category of harbour facility
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: A terminal provides facilities for handling particular forms of cargo (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 5343).

DataDictionaryReference.Name: yacht harbour/marina
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a harbour with facilities for small boats and yachts (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 3095).

DataDictionaryReference.Name: floating restaurant
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a permanently moored floating structure, such as an old ship, used as a restaurant.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: historic ship
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a ship of historical interest permanently moored as a tourist attraction.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: museum
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a permanently moored floating structure, such as an old ship, used as a museum.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: accommodation
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a permanently moored floating structure, such as an old ship, used for accommodation.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: floating breakwater
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a permanently moored floating structure, often constructed from old ships, used as a breakwater.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Category of lateral mark
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: There are two international buoyage regions, A and B, between which lateral marks differ. The buoyage region is encoded using the separate attribute MARSYS. When top-marks, retro reflectors and/or lights are fitted to these marks, they are encoded as separate objects.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: port-hand lateral mark
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: indicates the port boundary of a navigational channel or suggested route when proceeding in the 'conventional direction of buoyage'.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: starboard-hand lateral mark
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: indicates the starboard boundary of a navigational channel or suggested route when proceeding in the 'conventional direction of buoyage'.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: preferred channel to starboard lateral mark
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: at a point where a channel divides, when proceeding in the 'conventional direction of buoyage', the preferred channel (or primary route) is indicated by a modified port-hand lateral mark.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: preferred channel to port lateral mark
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: at a point where a channel divides, when proceeding in the 'conventional direction of buoyage', the preferred channel (or primary route) is indicated by a modified starboard-hand lateral mark.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: cairn
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a mound of stones, usually conical or pyramidal, raised as a landmark or to designate a point of importance in surveying. (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 601)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: cemetery
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an area of land for burying the dead.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: chimney
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a vertical structure containing a passage or flue for discharging smoke and gases. (Digital Geographic Information Standard - DIGEST)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: dish aerial
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a parabolic aerial for the receipt and transmission of high frequency radio signals. (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 1400)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: flagstaff (flagpole)
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a staff or pole on which flags are raised. (Digital Geographic Information Standard - DIGEST 1.28)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: flare stack
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a tall structure used for burning-off waste oil or gas. (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 1836). Normally showing a flame and located at refineries (IHO Chart specifications, M-4).

DataDictionaryReference.Name: mast
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a straight vertical piece of timber or a hollow cylinder. (adapted from Digital Geographic Information Standard - DIGEST)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: wind sock
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a tapered fabric sleeve mounted so as to catch and swing with the wind, thus indicating the wind direction. (Navigation dictionary, US National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration - NOAA, 1969)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: monument
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a structure erected or maintained as a memorial to a person or event. (Digital Geographic Information Standard - DIGEST)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: column (pillar)
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a cylindrical or slightly tapering body of considerably greater length than diameter erected vertically. (Oxford English Dictionary)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: memorial plaque
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a slab of metal, usually ornamented, erected as a memorial to a person or event.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: obelisk
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a tapering shaft usually of stone or concrete, square or rectangular in section, with a pyramidal apex. (Adapted from Oxford English Dictionary)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: statue
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a representation of a human, animal or fantasy figure in marble, bronze, etc.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: cross
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a monument, or other structure in form of a cross. (Funk and Wagnalls Dictionary)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: dome
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a landmark comprising a hemispherical or spheroidal shaped structure (adapted from the Macquarie Dictionary).

DataDictionaryReference.Name: radar scanner
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a device used for directing a radar beam through a search pattern (adapted from Navigation Dictionary, US National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration - NOAA, 1969)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: tower
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a relatively tall structure which may be used for observation, support, storage or communication etc. (Digital Geographic Information Working Group -DGIWG, Oct. 1987)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: windmill
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a wind driven system of vanes attached to a tower like structure (excluding wind-generated power plants). (Digital Geographic Information Standard - DIGEST)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: windmotor
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a modern structure for the use of windpower. (IHO Chart Specifications, M-4)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: spire/minaret
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a tall conical or pyramid-shaped structure often built on the roof or tower of a building, especially a church or mosque. (adapted from The New Shorter Oxford English Dictionary, 1993)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: large rock or boulder on land
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an isolated rocky formation or a single large stone (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition).

DataDictionaryReference.Name: large rock or boulder on land
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an isolated rocky formation or a single large stone (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition).

DataDictionaryReference.Name: dolphin
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a post or group of posts, which may support a deck, used for mooring or warping a vessel. (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 1433)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: post or pile
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a long heavy timber or section of steel, wood, concrete, etc., forced into the seabed to serve as a mooring facility. (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 3840)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: mooring buoy
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a buoy secured to the bottom by permanent moorings with means for mooring a vessel by use of its anchor chain or mooring lines. (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 575)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: clearing line
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a straight line that marks the boundary between a safe and a dangerous area or that passes clear of a navigational danger. (adapted from IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 826)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: transit line
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a line passing through one or more fixed marks.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: leading line bearing a recommended track
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a line passing through one or more clearly defined objects, along the path of which a vessel can approach safely up to a certain distance off. (Adapted from IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 2696)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: snag/stump
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a tree, branch or broken pile embedded in the ocean floor, river or lake bottom and not visible on the surface, forming thereby a hazard to vessels. (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 4794)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: wellhead
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a submarine structure projecting some distance above the seabed and capping a temporarily abandoned or suspended oil or gas well. (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 5976)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: diffuser
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a structure on an outfall through which liquids are discharged. The structure will usually project above the level of the outfall and can be an obstruction to navigation.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: crib
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a permanent structure set in the water, framed with wooden beams and filled with rocks or boulders. They are used to anchor log booms or support other constructions, e.g. submerged outfalls, diffusers etc.. They may always be dry, submerged or cover and uncover.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: fish haven
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: areas established by private interests, usually sport fishermen, to simulate natural reefs and wrecks that attract fish. The reefs are constructed by dumping assorted junk in areas which may be of very small extent or may stretch a considerable distance along a depth contour. Also called fishery reefs.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: foul area
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an area of numerous unidentified dangers to navigation. The area serves as a warning to the mariner that all dangers are not identified individually and that navigation through the area may be hazardous. Commonly used to encode areas behind danger lines on navigation charts. (adapted from IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 1915)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: foul ground
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: areas over which it is safe to navigate but which should be avoided for anchoring, taking the ground or ground fishing. (IHO Chart Specifications, M-4, 442.8)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: ice boom
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: floating barriers, anchored to the bottom, used to deflect the path of floating ice in order to prevent the obstruction of locks, intakes, etc., and to prevent damage to bridge piers and other structures. (Canadian Hydrographic Service, Chart specifications).

DataDictionaryReference.Name: ground tackle
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: equipment such as anchors, concrete blocks, chains and cables, etc., used to position floating structures such as trot and mooring buoys etc.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: boom
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a floating barrier used to protect a river or harbour mouth or to create a sheltered area for storage purposes. (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 505).

DataDictionaryReference.Name: oil retention (high pressure pipe)
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a pipe with holes from which air blows. When the air bubbles reach the surface they form a barrier which prevents the spread of oil. (Kort- og Matrikelstyrelsen, Denmark)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: floating oil barrier
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a floating tube shaped structure, with a curtain (2 metre) hanging under it, below the surface, which prevents the spread of oil. (Kort- og Matrikelstyrelsen, Denmark)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: outfall pipe
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a pipe (generally a sewer or drainage pipe) discharging in to the sea or a river.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: intake pipe
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a pipe taking water from a river or other body of water, to drive a mill or supply a canal, waterworks, etc. (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 2468)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: sewer
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a pipe in a sewage system for carrying water or sewage to a disposal area.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: supply pipe
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a pipe used for supplying of gas or liquid product.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: power transmission pylon/pole
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a vertical construction consisting, for example, of a steel framework or of pre-stressed concrete, to support a power transmission cable or line. (adapted from Digital Geographic Information Standard - DIGEST FACC 1.2)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: telephone/telegraph pylon/pole
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a pylon or pole used to support a telephone or telegraph line. (Digital Geographic Information Standard - DIGEST FACC 1.2)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: aerial cableway/sky pylon
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a tower or pylon supporting steel cables which convey cars, buckets, or other suspended carrier units. (adapted from Digital Geographic Information Standard - DIGEST FACC 1.2)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: bridge pylon/tower
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a tower, abutment or pylon from which a bridge deck is suspended. (adapted from Digital Geographic Information Standard - DIGEST FACC 1.2)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: bridge pier
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a support in the form of a pillar or pier for the spans of a bridge. (adapted from Digital Geographic Information Standard - DIGEST FACC 1.2)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: radar surveillance station
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a radar station established for traffic surveillance. (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 4144)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: nature reserve
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a tract of land managed so as to preserve it's flora, fauna, physical features, etc.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: bird sanctuary
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a place where birds are bred and protected.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: military area
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an area controlled by the military in which restrictions may apply. (Hydrographic Service, Royal Australian Navy)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: navigational aid safety zone
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an area around a navigational aid which vessels are prohibited from entering.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: waiting area
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an area reserved for vessels waiting to enter a harbour.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: fish sanctuary
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a place where fish are protected.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: ecological reserve
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a tract of land managed so as to preserve the relation of plants and living creatures to each other and to their surroundings.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: swinging area
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an area where vessels turn. (Service Hydrographique et Ocanographique de la Marine, France).

DataDictionaryReference.Name: water skiing area
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an area within which people may water ski and therefore vessel movement may be restricted.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: motorway
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a main road with separate carriageways and limited access, specially constructed and controlled for fast motor traffic.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: major road
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a hard surfaced (metalled) road; a main through route.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: minor road
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a secondary road for local traffic.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: track/path
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: track - a rough path or way formed by use. path - a way or track laid down for walking or made by continual treading.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: ramark, radar beacon transmitting continuously
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a radar marker beacon which continuously transmits a signal appearing as a radial line on a radar screen, the line indicating the direction of the beacon. Ramarks are intended primarily for marine use. The name 'ramark' is derived from the words radar marker. (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 4208)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: racon, radar transponder beacon
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a radar beacon which returns a coded signal which provides identification of the beacon, as well as range and bearing. The range and bearing are indicated by the location of the first character received on the radar screen. The name 'racon' is derived from the words radar beacon. (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 4132)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: leading racon/radar transponder beacon
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a radar beacon that may be used (in conjunction with at least one other radar beacon) to indicate a leading line.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: visitor's berth
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a berth set aside for the use of visiting vessels.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: nautical club
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a club for mariners generally associated with other small craft facilities.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: boat hoist
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a hoist for lifting boats out of the water.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: sailmaker
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a place where sails are made or may be taken for repair.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: boatyard
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a place on shore where boats may be built, stored and repaired.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: public inn
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a public house providing food, drink and accommodation. (The Collins Reference English Dictionary, 1992)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: restaurant
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a commercial establishment serving food. (The Collins Reference Dictionary, 1992)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: chandler
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a dealer in ships' supplies. (The Collins Reference Dictionary, 1992)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: provisions
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a place where food and other such supplies are available.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: doctor
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a place where a doctor is available to provide medical attention.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: pharmacy
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a place where medical drugs are dispensed.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: water tap
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a place where fresh water is available.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: fuel station
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a place where fuel is available.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: electricity
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a place where a connection to an electrical supply is available.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: bottle gas
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a place where bottled gas is available.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: showers
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a place where showers are available.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: launderette
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a place where there are facilities for washing clothes.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: public toilets
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a place where toilets are available for public use.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: post box
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a place where mail may be posted.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: public telephone
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a place where a telephone is available for public use.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: refuse bin
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a place where refuse may be dumped.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: car park
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a place where cars may be parked.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: parking for boats and trailers
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a place on shore where boats and/or trailers may be parked.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: caravan site
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a place where caravans may be parked or where caravan accommodation is provided.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: camping site
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a place where visitors may pitch tents and camp.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: sewerage pump-out station
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a place where sewerage may be pumped off a vessel.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: emergency telephone
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a place where a telephone is available for emergency use only.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: landing/launching place for boats
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a place where boats may be landed or launched.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: visitors mooring
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a mooring set aside for the use of visiting vessels.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: scrubbing berth
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a place where vessels may berth for the purpose of careening.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: picnic area
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a place where people may go to eat a picnic.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: mechanics workshop
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a place where mechanical repairs can be undertaken to engines or other vessel equipment.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: guard and/or security service
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a place where a vessel is patrolled by a security service or stored in a secure lockup.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: canal
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an artificial water course used for navigation.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: river
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a relatively large natural stream of water.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: breakwater
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a structure protecting a shore area, harbour, anchorage, or basin from waves. (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 542)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: groyne (groin)
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a low artificial wall-like structure of durable material extending from the land to seaward for a particular purpose, such as to prevent coast erosion (adapted from IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 2525 and IHO Chart Specifications, M-4)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: pier (jetty)
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a long, narrow structure extending into the water to afford a berthing place for vessels, to serve as a promenade, etc. (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 3833)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: promenade pier
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a pier built only for recreational purposes. (IHO Chart Specifications, M-4)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: wharf (quay)
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a structure serving as a berthing place for vessels. (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 5985)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: training wall
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a wall or bank, often submerged, built to direct or confine the flow of a river or tidal current, or to promote a scour action. (Adapted from IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 5586 and IHO Chart Specifications, M-4).

DataDictionaryReference.Name: rip rap
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: A layer of broken rock, cobbles, boulders, or fragments of sufficient size to resist the erosive forces of flowing water and wave action. (Adapted from Marine Chart Manual, US National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration - NOAA, 1992)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: revetment
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: facing of stone or other material, either permanent or temporary, placed along the edge of a stream, river or canal to stabilize the bank and to protect it from the erosive action of the stream. (Adapted from IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 4379)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: sea wall
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an embankment or wall for protection against waves or tidal action along a shore or water front. (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 4584)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: landing steps
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: steps at the shoreline as the connection between land and water on different levels.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: ramp
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a sloping structure that can either be used, as a landing place, at variable water levels, for small vessels, landing ships, or a ferry boat, or for hauling a cradle carrying a vessel, which may include rails. (Adapted from IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 4209)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: slipway
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: the prepared and usually reinforced inclined surface on which keel- and bilge-blocks are laid for supporting a vessel under construction. (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 4775)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: fender
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a protective structure designed to cushion the impact of a vessel and prevent damage.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: solid face wharf
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a wharf consisting of a solid wall of concrete, masonry, wood etc., such that the water cannot circulate freely under the wharf. The type of construction affects ship-handling; for example, a solid face wharf may give shelter from tidal streams, but under certain circumstances a cusion of water may build up between such a wharf and a ship attempting to berth at it, causing difficulties in ship handling. (Capt. A. Rae, pilot, Port of Halifax and Mr. R. Morash, wharf building engineer, Transport Canada)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: open face wharf
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a wharf supported on piles or other structures which allow free circulation of water under the wharf. (Capt. A. Rae, pilot, Port of Halifax and Mr. R. Morash, wharf building engineer, Transport Canada)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: embankment
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an artificial elevation constructed from earth, stone, etc. carrying a road, railway or similar or serving to dam water.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: dune
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a mound, ridge or hill of drifted material on the sea coast or in a desert. (adapted from IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 1496)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Category of special purpose mark
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: A mark may be a beacon, a buoy, a signpost or may take another form.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: cable mark
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a mark used to indicate the position of submarine cables or the point at which they run on to the land.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: recording mark
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a mark used to record data for scientific purposes.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: recreation zone mark
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a mark used to indicate a recreation zone.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: ferry crossing mark
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a mark indicating that a ferry route crosses the ship route; often used with a 'sound ship's siren' mark.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: pipeline mark
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a mark used to indicate the position of submarine pipelines or the point at which they run on to the land.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: clearing mark
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a mark used to indicate a clearing line.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: foul ground mark
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a mark indicating a foul ground.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: entry prohibited mark
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a mark indicating that entry is prohibited.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: channel separation mark
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a mark indicating the point at which a channel divides separately into two channels.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: marine farm mark
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a mark indicating the existence of a fish, mussel, oyster or pearl farm/ culture.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: based on a system of fixed marks
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a straight route (known as a recommended track, range or leading line), which comprises at least two structures (usually beacons or daymarks) and/or natural features, which may carry lights and/or top-marks. The structures/features are positioned so that when observed to be in line, a vessel can follow a known bearing with safety. (adapted from International Association of Lighthouse Authorities - IALA Aids to Navigation Guide, 1990)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: not based on a system of fixed marks
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a route (known as a recommended track or preferred route) which is not based on a series of structures or features in line.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: wood in general (inc mixed wood)
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: growing trees densely occupying a tract of land. (The Concise Oxford Dictionary)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: tree in general
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a woody perennial plant, having a self supporting main stem or trunk.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: non-dangerous wreck
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a wreck which is not considered to be dangerous to surface navigation.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: dangerous wreck
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a wreck which is considered to be dangerous to surface navigation.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Category of zone of confidence in data
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: The CATZOC attribute definitions are currently the subject of review and the results of this review will be promulgated as soon as possible in the S-57 Corrections Document. See the CATZOC Table in S-57 for the full table layout.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: zone of confidence U (data not assessed)
horizontal stripes
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: straight bands or stripes of differing colours painted horizontally.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: vertical stripes
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: straight bands or stripes of differing colours painted vertically.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: diagonal stripes
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: straight bands or stripes of differing colours painted diagonally (ie not horizontally or vertically).

DataDictionaryReference.Name: squared
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: often referred to as checker plate, where alternate colours are used to create squares similar to a chess or draught board. The pattern may be straight or diagonal.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: stripes (direction unknown)
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: straight bands or stripes of differing colours painted in an unknown direction.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: border stripe
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a band or stripe of colour which is displayed around the outer edge of the object, which may also form a border to an inner pattern or plain colour.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Communication channel
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: A channel number assigned to a specific radio frequency, frequencies or frequency band.
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: The expected input is the specific VHF-Channel. The attribute 'communication channel' encodes the various VHF-channels used for communication.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: radar conspicuous (has radar reflector)
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an object which returns a strong radar echo, having a radar reflector.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: visually conspicuous
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: term applied to an object either natural or artificial which is distinctly and notably visible from seaward. (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 984)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: not visually conspicuous
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an object which is visible from seaward, but is not conspicuous.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Date end
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The latest date on which an object (e.g., a buoy) will be present.
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: This attribute is to be used to indicate the removal or cancellation of an object at a specific date in the future. See also 'periodic date end' (PEREND).

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Date start
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The earliest date on which an object (e.g., a buoy) will be present.
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: This attribute is to be used to indicate the deployment or implementation of an object at a specific date in the future. See also 'periodic date start' (PERSTA).

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Depth range value 1
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The minimum (shoalest) value of a depth range.
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: Where the area dries, the value is negative. The unit of measure is defined in the DUNI subfield of the DSPM record or in the DUNITS attribute of the M_UNIT meta object class, e.g., metre (m). The resolution is 0.1 m or 0.1 fm or 0.1 ft.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Depth range value 2
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The maximum (deepest) value of a depth range.
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: Where the area dries, the value is negative. The unit of measure is defined in the DUNI subfield of the DSPM record or in the DUNITS attribute of the M_UNIT meta object class, e.g., metre (m). The resolution is 0.1 m or 0.1 fm or 0.1 ft.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Elevation
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The altitude of the ground level of an object, measured from a specified vertical datum.
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: The unit of measure is defined in the HUNI subfield of the DSPM record or in the HUNITS attribute of the M_UNIT meta object class, e.g., metre (m). The resolution is 0.1 m or 0.1 ft.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: light shown without change of character
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a light shown throughout the 24 hours without change of character. IHO Chart pecifications, M-4

DataDictionaryReference.Name: daytime light
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a light which is only exhibited by day.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: fog light
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a light which is exhibited in fog or conditions of reduced visibility.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: night light
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a light which is only exhibited at night.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: harbour-master's office
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: the office of the local official who has charge of mooring and berthing of vessels, collecting harbour fees, etc. (adapted from IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 2191)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: custom office
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an office which is charged with enforcing customs regulations.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: health office
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: the office which is charged with the administration of health laws and sanitary inspections. (adapted from The New Shorter Oxford English Dictionary, 1993)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: hospital
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an institution or establishment providing medical or surgical treatment for the ill or wounded. (The New Shorter Oxford English Dictionary, 1993)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: post office
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: the public department, agency or organisation responsible primarily for the collection, transmission and distribution of mail. (The New Shorter Oxford English Dictionary, 1993)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: hotel
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an establishment, especially of a comfortable or luxurious kind, where paying visitors are provided with accommodation, meals and other services. (The New Shorter Oxford English Dictionary, 1993)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: railway station
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a building with platforms where trains arrive, load, discharge and depart. (The New Shorter Oxford English Dictionary, 1993)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: police station
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: the office of the local police force.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: water-police station
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: the headquarters of a local water-police force.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: pilot office
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: the office or headquarters of pilots; the place where the services of a pilot may be obtained. (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 3845)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: pilot lookout
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a distinctive structure on shore from which personnel keep watch upon events at sea or along the coast. (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 2917)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: bank office
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an office for custody, deposit, loan, exchange or issue of money. (adapted from The New Shorter Oxford English Dictionary, 1993)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: headquarters for district control
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: the quarters of an executive officer (director, manager, etc.) with responsibility for an administrative area.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: transit shed/warehouse
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a building or part of a building for storage of wares or goods. (adapted from The New Shorter Oxford English Dictionary, 1993)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: factory
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a building or buildings with equipment for manufacturing; a workshop. (The New Shorter Oxford English Dictionary, 1993)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: power station
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a stationary plant containing apparatus for large scale conversion of some form of energy (such as hydraulic, steam, chemical or nuclear energy) into electrical energy. (McGraw-Hill Dictionary of Scientific and Technical Terms, 3rd Edition, 1984)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: administrative
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a building for the management of affairs. (adapted from The New Shorter Oxford English Dictionary, 1993)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: educational facility
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a building concerned with education (eg. school, college, university, etc.)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: church
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a building for public Christian worship. (The New Shorter Oxford English Dictionary, 1993)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: chapel
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a place for Christian worship other than a parish, cathedral or church, especially one attached to a private house or institution. (The New Shorter Oxford English Dictionary, 1993)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: temple
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a building for public Jewish worship. (adapted from The New Shorter Oxford English Dictionary, 1993)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: pagoda
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a Hindu or Buddhist temple or sacred building. (The New Shorter Oxford English Dictionary, 1993)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: shinto shrine
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a building for public Shinto worship. (adapted from The New Shorter Oxford English Dictionary, 1993)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: buddhist temple
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: see pagoda.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: mosque
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a Muslim place of worship. (The New Shorter Oxford English Dictionary, 1993)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: marabout
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a shrine marking the burial place of a Muslim holy man. (The New Shorter Oxford English Dictionary, 1993)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: lookout
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: keeping a watch upon events at sea or along the coast. (adapted from IHO Dictionary, S-32,5th Edition,2917)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: communication
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: transmitting and/or receiving electronic communication signals. (adapted from Digital Geographic Information Standard - DIGEST)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: television
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: broadcast of television signals.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: radio
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: broadcast of radio signals.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: radar
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a method, system or technique of using beamed, reflected, and timed radio waves for detecting, locating, or tracking objects, and for measuring altitudes. (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition,4158)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: light support
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: supporting a light

DataDictionaryReference.Name: microwave
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: broadcasting and receiving signals using microwaves.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: cooling
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: dissipating heat.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: observation
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a place from which the surroundings can be observed but at which a watch is not habitually maintained. (adapted from IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition,2917)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: time ball
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a visual time signal in form of a ball

DataDictionaryReference.Name: clock
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: visual time signal. (adapted from S-32, 5th Edition, 5536)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: control
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: used to control the flow of air, rail, or marine traffic. (Digital Geographic Information Standard - DIGEST)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: airship mooring
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a facility to secure an airship. (adapted from Digital Geographic Information Standard - DIGEST)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: stadium
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a large usually unroofed building with tiers of seats for spectators

DataDictionaryReference.Name: bus station
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a location at which buses arrive and from which they depart.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Height
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The value of the vertical distance to the highest point of the object, measured from a specified vertical datum.
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: Height must not be used for floating objects. The unit of measure is defined in the HUNI subfield of the DSPM record or in the HUNITS attribute of the M_UNIT meta object class, e.g., metre (m). The resolution is 0.1 m or 0.1 ft.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Horizontal clearance
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The width of an object, such as a canal or a tunnel, which is available for safe navigation. This may, or may not, be the same as the total physical width of the object.
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: The unit of measure is defined in the HUNI subfield of the DSPM record or in the HUNITS attribute of the M_UNIT meta object class, e.g., metre (m). The resolution is 0.1 m or 0.1 ft.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Horizontal length
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: A measurement of the longer of two linear axis. (Digital Geographic Information Working Group -DGIWG, Oct.87)
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: The unit of measure is defined in the HUNI subfield of the DSPM record or in the HUNITS attribute of the M_UNIT meta object class, e.g., metre (m). The resolution is 0.1 m or 0.1 ft.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Horizontal width
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: A measurement of the shorter of two linear axis. (Digital Geographic Information Working Group -DGIWG, Oct.87)
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: The unit of measure is defined in the HUNI subfield of the DSPM record or in the HUNITS attribute of the M_UNIT meta object class, e.g., metre (m). The resolution is 0.1 m or 0.1 ft.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Information
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: Textual information about the object.
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: The textual information could be, for example, a list, a table or a text. This attribute should be used, for example, to hold the information that is shown on paper charts by cautionary and explanatory notes. No formatting of text is possible within INFORM. If formatted text is required, then the attribute TXTDSC must be used.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Jurisdiction
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: The jurisdiction applicable to an administrative area

DataDictionaryReference.Name: international
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: involving more than one country; covering more than one national area.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: national
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an area administered or controlled by a single nation.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: national sub-division
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an area smaller than the nation in which it lies.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Light characteristic
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: A selection of the above characteristics is defined and illustrated diagrammatically in IHO Chart Specifications, M-4, 471.2.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: fixed
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a signal light that shows continuously, in any given direction, with constant luminous intensity and colour. (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 2780)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: flashing
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a rhythmic light in which the total duration of light in a period is clearly shorter than the total duration of darkness and all the appearances of light are of equal duration. (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 2783)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: long-flashing
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a flashing light in which a single flash of not less than two seconds duration is regularly repeated. (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 2796)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: quick-flashing
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a light exhibiting without interruption very rapid regular alternations of light and darkness. (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 2803)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: isophased
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a light with all durations of light and darkness equal. (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 2779)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: interrupted quick-flashing
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a quick light in which the sequence of flashes is interrupted by regularly repeated eclipses of constant and long duration. (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 2790)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Multiplicity of lights
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The number of lights of identical character that exist as a co-located group.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: masonry
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: constructed of brick or stone.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: concreted
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: constructed of concrete, a material made of sand and gravel that is united by cement into a hardened mass used for roads, foundations, etc. (adapted from the Illustrated Contemporary Dictionary, Encyclopaedic Edition, 1978)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: loose boulders
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: constructed from large stones or blocks of concrete, often placed loosely for protection against waves or water turbulence.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: hard surfaced
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: constructed with a surface of hard material, usually a term applied to roads surfaced with asphalt or concrete.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: unsurfaced
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: constructed with no extra protection, usually a term applied to roads not surfaced with a hard material.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: wooden
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: constructed from wood.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: metal
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: constructed from metal.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: glass reinforced plastic (GRP)
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: constructed from a plastic material strengthened with fibres of glass.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: painted
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: the application of paint to some other construction or natural feature.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Nationality
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The nationality of the specific objec
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: Indication: the nationality is encoded by a 2 character- code following ISO 3166 (refer to Annex A to S-57 Appendix A);

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Information in national language
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: Textual information in national language characters
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: The attribute 'information in national language' encodes any textual information about an object using a specified national language. The textual information could be, for example, a list, a table or a text. This attribute should be used, for example, to hold the information that is shown on paper charts by cautionary and explanatory notes.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Object name in national language
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: Name of object in national language characters
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: The attribute 'object name in national language' encodes the individual name of an object in the specified national language.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Textual description in national language
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The file name of an external text file that contains the text in a national language.
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: The attribute 'textual description in national language' indicates whether a text file containing text extracted from relevant pilot books or navigational publications is available.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Object name
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The individual name of an object.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Orientation
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The angular distance measured from true north to the major axis of the object. (Digital Geographic Information Working Group -DGIWG, Oct.87)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Periodic date end
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The end of the active period for a seasonal object (e.g. a buoy).
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: See also 'date end' (DATEND).

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Periodic date start
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The start of the active period for a seasonal object (e.g. a buoy).
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: See also 'date start' (DATSTA).

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Pictorial representation
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: Indicates whether a pictorial representation of the object is available.
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: The 'pictorial representation' could be a drawing or a photo. The string encodes the file name of an external graphic file (pixel/vector).

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Pilot district
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The area within which a particular pilotage service operates.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Positional Accuracy
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The best estimate of the accuracy of a position. The expected input is the maximum of the two-dimensional error. The error is assumed to be positive and negative. The plus/minus character shall not be encoded.
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: The unit of measure is defined in the PUNI subfield of the DSPM record, e.g., metre (m). The resolution is 0.1 m or 0.1 mm.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Product
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: The attribute 'product' encodes the various substances which are transported, stored or exploited.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: oil
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a thick, slippery liquid that will not dissolve in water, usually petroleum based in the context of storage tanks. (adapted from the Oxford Minidictionary, Third Edition)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: gas
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a substance with particles that can move freely, usually a fuel substance in the context of storage tanks. (adapted from the Oxford Minidictionary, Third Edition)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: water
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a colourless, odourless, tasteless liquid that is a compound of hydrogen and oxygen. (adapted from the Oxford Minidictionary, Third Edition)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: stone
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a general term for rock fragments. (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 5059)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: coal
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a hard black mineral that is burned as fuel. (adapted from the Oxford Minidictionary, Third Edition)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: ore
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a solid rock or mineral from which metal is obtained. (adapted form the Oxford Minidictionary, Third Edition)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: chemicals
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: any substance obtained by or used in a chemical process. (adapted from the Oxford Minidictionary, Third Edition)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: drinking water
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: water that is suitable for human consumption. (adapted from the Oxford Minidictionary, Third Edition)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: sand
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: tiny grains of crushed or worn rock. (adapted from the Oxford Minidictionary, Third Edition)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: timber
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: wood prepared for use in building or carpentry. (adapted from the Oxford Minidictionary, Third Edition)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: scrap metal
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: discarded metal suitable for being reprocessed. (adapted from the Oxford Minidictionary, Third Edition)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: cement
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a substance made of powdered lime and clay, mixed with water. (adapted from the Websters New World Dictionary)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: grain
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a small hard seed, especially that of any cereal plant such as wheat, rice, corn, rye etc. (adapted from the Websters New World Dictionary)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: approximate
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a position that is considered to be less than third-order accuracy, but is generally considered to be within 30.5 metres of its correct geographic location. Also may apply to an object whose position does not remain fixed. (adapted from IHO Dictionary, S-32, 213, 3967, and IHO Specifications, M-4, 424.1)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: precisely known
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a position that is of a known value, such as the position of an anchor berth or other defined object.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Quality of sounding measurement
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: The attribute 'quality of sounding measurement' indicates the reliability of the value of sounding.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: depth known
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: the depth from chart datum to the bottom is a known value.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: depth unknown
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: the depth from chart datum to the bottom is unknown.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: value reported (not surveyed)
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: depth value obtained from a report, but not fully surveyed.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: maintained depth
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: the depth at which a channel is kept by human influence, usually by dredging. (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 3057)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: not regularly maintained
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: depths may be altered by human influence, but will not be routinely maintained.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Radar wave length
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The distance between two successive peaks (or other points of identical phase) on an electromagnetic wave in the radar band of the electromagnetic spectrum.
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: The attribute 'radar transponder beacon wavelength' encodes the specific wavelength at which a radar transponder beacon transmits. Radar transponder beacons generally work on the following wavelengths: 3cm (X) Band, 10cm (S) Band. Nevertheless, wavelengths outside the marine band are used.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Reference year for magnetic variation
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The official legal statute of each kind of restricted area.
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: Defines the kind of restriction(s), e.g., the restriction for 'a game preserve' may be 'entry prohibited', the restriction for an 'anchoring prohibition' is 'anchoring prohibited'. The complete information about the restriction(s), actually held in handbooks or other publications, may be encoded by the attribute 'TXTDSC'. A short explanation may be given by the use of the attribute 'INFORM'.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: anchoring prohibited
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an area within which anchoring is not permitted.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Scale minimum
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The minimum scale at which the object may be used e.g. for ECDIS presentation.
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: The modulus of the scale is indicated, that is 1:1 250 000 is encoded as 1250000.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Signal frequency
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The frequency of a signal.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Signal generation
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: The attribute 'signal generation' encodes the mechanism used to generate a fog signal.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: automatically
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: signal generation is initiated by a self regulating mechanism such as a timer or light sensor.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: by wave action
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: the signal is generated by the motion of the sea surface such as a bell in a buoy.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Signal group
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The number of signals, the combination of signals or the morse character(s) within one period of full sequence.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Signal period
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The time occupied by an entire cycle of intervals of light and eclipse.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Signal sequence
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The sequence of times occupied by intervals of light and eclipse for all 'light characteristics' except for occulting where the sequence of times is occupied by intervals of eclipse and light.
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: The 'signal sequence' for all 'light characteristics' except for occulting is indicated using a fixed format to encode the value of intervals of light (L) and eclipse (E).

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Source date
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The production date of the source, e.g. the date of measurement.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Source indication
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: Information about the source of the object.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Sounding accuracy
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The best estimate of the accuracy of the sounding data. The maximum of the one-dimensional error. The error is assumed to be positive and negative. The plus/minus character shall not be encoded.
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: The unit of measure is defined in the DUNI subfield of the DSPM record or in the DUNITS attribute of the M_UNIT meta object class, e.g., metre (m). The resolution is 0.1 m or 0.1 fm or 0.1 ft.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: occasional
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: acting on special occasions; happening irregularly. (The Concise Oxford Dictionary, 7th Edition)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: recommended
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: presented as worthy of confidence, acceptance, use, etc. (The Macquarie Dictionary, 1988)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: not in use
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: no longer used for the purpose intended; disused.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: private
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: not in public ownership or operation.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: mandatory
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: compulsory; enforced. (The Concise Oxford Dictionary, 7th Edition)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: illuminated
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: lit by floodlights, strip lights, etc.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: public
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: belonging to, available to, used or shared by, the community as a whole and not restricted to private use. (adapted from The New Shorter Oxford English Dictionary, 1993)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: watched
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: looked at or observed over a period of time especially so as to be aware of any movement or change. (adapted from The New Shorter Oxford English Dictionary, 1993)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: un-watched
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: usually automatic in operation, without any permanently-stationed personnel to superintend it. (adapted from IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 2814)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Survey authority
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The authority which was responsible for the survey.
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: The attribute 'survey authority' encodes the name of the source survey authority.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Survey date - end
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The end date of the survey.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Survey date - start
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The start date of the survey.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: controlled survey
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a thorough survey usually conducted with reference to guidelines.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: found by echo-sounder
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: the depth was determined by using an instrument that determines depth of water by measuring the time interval between emission of a sonic or ultrasonic signal and return of its echo from the bottom. (adapted from IHO Dictionary, S-32, 1547)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: found by side-scan-sonar
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: the depth was computed from a record produced by active sonar in which fixed acoustic beams are directed into the water perpendicularly to the direction of travel to scan the bottom and generate a record of the bottom configuration. (adapted from IHO Dictionary, S-32, 4710)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: found by multi-beam
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: the depth was determined by using a wide swath echo sounder that uses multiple beams to measure depths directly below and transverse to the ship's track. (adapted from IHO Dictionary, S-32, 3339)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: found by diver
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: the depth was determined by a person skilled in the practice of diving. (adapted from IHO Dictionary, S-32, 1422)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: found by lead-line
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: the depth was determined by using a line, graduated with attached marks and fastened to a sounding lead. (adapted from IHO Dictionary, S-32, 2698)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: swept by wire-drag
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: the given area was determined to be free from navigational dangers to a certain depth by towing a buoyed wire at the desired depth by two launches, or a least depth was identified using the same technique. (adapted from IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5248, 6013)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: found by laser
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: the depth was determined by using an instrument that measures distance by emitting timed pulses of laser light and measuring the time between emission and reception of the reflected pulses. (adapted from IHO Dictionary, S-32, 2763)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: swept by vertical acoustic system
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: the given area has been swept using a system comprised of multiple echo sounder transducers attached to booms deployed from the survey vessel.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: found by electromagnetic sensor
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: the depth was determined by using an instrument that compares electromagnetic signals. (adapted from IHO Dictionary, S-32, 1571)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: photogrammetry
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: the depth was determined by applying mathematical techniques to photographs. (adapted from IHO Dictionary, S-32, 3791)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: satellite imagery
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: the depth was determined by using instruments placed aboard an artificial satellite. (adapted from IHO Dictionary, S-32, 4509)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: found by levelling
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: the depth was determined by using levelling techniques to find the elevation of the point relative to a datum. (adapted from IHO Dictionary, S-32, 2741)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: swept by side-scan-sonar
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: the given area was determined to be free from navigational dangers to a certain depth by towing a side-scan-sonar. (adapted from IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5248, 4710) [415.2]

DataDictionaryReference.Name: computer generated
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: the sounding was determined from a bottom model constructed using a computer.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Topmark/daymark shape
DataDictionaryReference.Reference: 463.1 (for International Association of Lighthouse Authorities - IALA systems only)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: cone, point up
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: is where the vertex points up.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: cone, point down
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: is where the vertex points down.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: sphere
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a body the surface of which is at all points equidistant from the centre. (The New Shorter Oxford English Dictionary. 1993. vol 2). Spheres are commonly used as International Association of Lighthouse Authorities - IALA topmarks (safe water).

DataDictionaryReference.Name: 2 spheres
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: two black spheres are commonly used as an International Association of Lighthouse Authorities - IALA topmark (isolated danger).

DataDictionaryReference.Name: cylinder (can)
