DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a solid geometrical figure generated by straight lines fixed in direction and describing with one of point a closed curve, especially a circle (in which case the figure is circular cylinder, it's ends being parallel circles). (The New Shorter Oxford English Dictionary. 1993. vol 2). Cylinders are commonly used as International Association of Lighthouse Authorities - IALA topmarks (lateral).

DataDictionaryReference.Name: board
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: usually of rectangular shape, made from timber or metal and used to provide a contrast with the natural background of a daymark. The actual daymark is often painted on to this board.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: x-shape (St. Andrew's cross)
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: having a shape or a cross-section like the capital letter X. (The New Shorter Oxford English Dictionary. 1993. vol 2). An x-shape as an International Association of Lighthouse Authorities - IALA topmark should be 3 dimensional in shape. It is made of at least three crossed bars.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: upright cross (St George's cross)
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a cross with one vertical member and one horizontal member, i.e. similar in shape to the character '+'.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: cube, point up
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a cube standing on one of its vertexes.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: 2 cones, point to point
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: 2 cones, one above the other, with their vertices together in the centre.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: 2 cones, base to base
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: 2 cones, one above the other, with their bases together in the centre and their vertices pointing up and down.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: rhombus (diamond)
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a plane figure having four equal sides and equal opposite angles (two acute and two obtuse); an oblique equilateral parallelogram. (The New Shorter Oxford English Dictionary. 1993. vol 2)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: 2 cones (points upward)
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: 2 cones, one above the other, with their their vertices pointing up

DataDictionaryReference.Name: 2 cones (points downward)
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: 2 cones, one above the other, with their their vertices pointing down

DataDictionaryReference.Name: besom, point up (broom or perch)
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a bundle of rods or twigs. (The New Shorter Oxford English Dictionary. 1993. vol 1)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: besom, point down (broom or perch)
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a bundle of rods or twigs. (The New Shorter Oxford English Dictionary. 1993. vol 1)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: flag
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a flag mounted on a short pole.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: sphere over rhombus
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: A sphere located above a rhombus.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: square
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a plane figure with four right angles and four equal straight sides (The New Shorter Oxford English Dictionary. 1993. vol 2)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: rectangle, horizontal
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a plane figure with four right angles and four straight sides, opposite sides being parallel and equal in length where the two longer opposite sides are standing horizontally (The New Shorter Oxford English Dictionary. 1993. vol 2).

DataDictionaryReference.Name: rectangle, vertical
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a plane figure with four right angles and four straight sides, opposite sides being parallel and equal in length where the two longer opposite sides are standing vertically (The New Shorter Oxford English Dictionary. 1993. vol 2).

DataDictionaryReference.Name: trapezium, up
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a quadrilateral having one pair of opposite sides parallel which stands on its longer parallel side. (The New Shorter Oxford English Dictionary. 1993. vol 2).

DataDictionaryReference.Name: trapezium, down
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a quadrilateral having one pair of opposite sides parallel which stands on its shorter parallel side. (The New Shorter Oxford English Dictionary. 1993. vol 2).

DataDictionaryReference.Name: triangle, point up
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a figure having three angles and three sides with point up. (New Shorter Oxford English Dictionary. 1993. vol 2)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: triangle, point down
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a figure having three angles and three sides with point down. (New Shorter Oxford English Dictionary. 1993. vol 2)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: circle
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a perfectly round plane figure whose circumference is everywhere equidistant from its centre. (The New Shorter Oxford English Dictionary. 1993. vol 1)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: two upright crosses (one over the other)
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: two upright crosses, generally vertically disposed one above the other.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: T-shape
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: having a shape like the capital letter T.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: triangle pointing up over a circle
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a triangle, vertex uppermost, located above a circle.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: upright cross over a circle
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an upright cross located above a circle.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: rhombus over a circle
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a rhombus located above a circle.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: circle over a triangle pointing up
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a circle located over a triangle, vertex uppermost.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: inbound
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: traffic flow in a general direction toward a port or similar destination.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: outbound
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: traffic flow in a general direction away from a port or similar point of origin.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: one-way
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: traffic flow in one general direction only.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: two-way
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: traffic flow in two generally opposite directions.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Textual description
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The string encodes the file name of an external text file that contains the text in English
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: The attribute 'textual description' indicates that a file containing text extracted from relevant pilot books or navigational publications is available.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Value of depth contour
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The depth of a sea bottom contour.
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: Drying contours are indicated by a negative value. The unit of measure is defined in the DUNI subfield of the DSPM record or in the DUNITS attribute of the M_UNIT meta object class, e.g., metre (m). The resolution is 0.1 m or 0.1 fm or 0.1 ft.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Value of maximum range
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The extreme distance at which an object can be seen or a signal detected.
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: This attribute does not apply to lights where the attribute 'value of nominal range' should be used.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Value of sounding
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The value of the measurement of a sounding relative to the chart datum.
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: A drying height is indicated by a negative value. The unit of measure is defined in the DUNI subfield of the DSPM record or in the DUNITS attribute of the M_UNIT meta object class, e.g., metre (m). The resolution is 0.1 m or 0.1 fm or 0.1 ft.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Vertical clearance, closed
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The vertical clearance of an object in closed condition (e.g. a closed lifting bridge) measured from the plane towards the object overhead.
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: The unit of measure is defined in the HUNI subfield of the DSPM record or in the HUNITS attribute of the M_UNIT meta object class, e.g., metre (m). The resolution is 0.1 m or 0.1 ft.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Vertical clearance
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The vertical clearance measured from the plane towards the object overhead.
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: In the case of cables carrying high voltages an additional clearance of from 2 to 5 metres may be needed to avoid an electrical discharge. When known, the authorized safe clearance (known in the UK as the Safe Overhead Clearance) which is the physical clearance minus a safety margin shall be stated (IHO Chart Specifications, M-4). See also 'vertical clearance safe'. The unit of measure is defined in the HUNI subfield of the DSPM record or in the HUNITS attribute of the M_UNIT meta object class, e.g., metre (m). The resolution is 0.1 m or 0.1 ft.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Vertical clearance, open
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The vertical clearance of an object in opened condition (e.g. an opened lifting bridge) measured from the plane towards the object overhead.
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: The unit of measure is defined in the HUNI subfield of the DSPM record or in the HUNITS attribute of the M_UNIT meta object class, e.g., metre (m). The resolution is 0.1 m or 0.1 ft.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Water level effect
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: The attribute 'water level effect' encodes the effect of the surrounding water on an object.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: partly submerged at high water
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: partially covered and partially dry at high water.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: always dry
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: not covered at high water under average meteorological conditions.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: always under water/submerged
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: remains covered by water at all times under average meteorological conditions.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: covers and uncovers
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: expression intended to indicate an area of a reef or other projection from the bottom of a body of water which periodically extends above and is submerged below the surface. Also referred to as dries or uncovers. (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 1111)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: awash
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: flush with, or washed by the waves at low water under average meteorological conditions. (adapted from IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 308)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: additional mark
DataDictionaryReference.Remark: The kind and location of an additional mark at a notice mark

DataDictionaryReference.Name: top (board)
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a rectengular board at the top of the main sign

DataDictionaryReference.Name: bottom (board)
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a rectengular board at the bottom of the main sign

DataDictionaryReference.Name: right (triangle to the right)
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a triangular board at the right side of the main sign

DataDictionaryReference.Name: left (triangle to the left)
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a triangular board at the left side of the main sign

DataDictionaryReference.Name: bottom (triangle to the bottom)
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a triangular board at the bottom of the main sign

DataDictionaryReference.Name: convoy
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a rigid or towed convoy of craft

DataDictionaryReference.Name: formation
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: the manner in which a convoy is assembled

DataDictionaryReference.Name: rigid convoy
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a pushed convoy or breasted up formation

DataDictionaryReference.Name: pushed convoy
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a rigid assembly of craft of which at least one is positioned in front of the craft providing the power for propelling the convoy, known as the "pusher(s)"; a convoy composed of a pusher craft and a pushed craft coupled so as to permit guided articulation is also consid-ered as rigid

DataDictionaryReference.Name: breasted up formation
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an assembly of craft coupled rigidly side by side, none of which is positioned in front of the craft propelling the assembly

DataDictionaryReference.Name: towed convoy
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an assembly of one or more craft, floating establishments or floating installations towed by one or more self-propelled craft forming part of the convoy

DataDictionaryReference.Name: convoy
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a rigid or towed convoy of craft

DataDictionaryReference.Name: formation
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: the manner in which a convoy is assembled

DataDictionaryReference.Name: rigid convoy
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a pushed convoy or breasted up formation

DataDictionaryReference.Name: pushed convoy
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a rigid assembly of craft of which at least one is positioned in front of the craft providing the power for propelling the convoy, known as the "pusher(s)"; a convoy composed of a pusher craft and a pushed craft coupled so as to permit guided articulation is also consid-ered as rigid

DataDictionaryReference.Name: breasted up formation
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an assembly of craft coupled rigidly side by side, none of which is positioned in front of the craft propelling the assembly

DataDictionaryReference.Name: towed convoy
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an assembly of one or more craft, floating establishments or floating installations towed by one or more self-propelled craft forming part of the convoy

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Avarage Passing Time Reference
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The string encodes the file name of an external file

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Beam range value 1
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The minimum value of the beam range the particular article/clause of the applicable law/regulation is dealing with

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Beam range value 2
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The maximum value of the beam range the particular article/clause of the applicable law/regulation is dealing with

DataDictionaryReference.Name: bunker vessel available
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a bunker vessel is available

DataDictionaryReference.Name: no bunker vessel available
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a bunker vessel is not available

DataDictionaryReference.Name: unrestricted anchorage
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an area in which vessels anchor or may anchor. (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 130)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: deep water anchorage
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an area in which vessels of deep draught anchor or may anchor.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: tanker anchorage
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an area in which tankers anchor or may anchor.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: explosives anchorage
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an area set apart for anchored ships discharging or receiving explosives. (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 1732)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: quarantine anchorage
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an area where a vessel anchors when satisfying quarantine regulations. (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 4117)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: sea-plane anchorage
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an area in which sea-planes anchor or may anchor.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: small craft anchorage
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an area in which yachts and small boats anchor or may anchor.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: anchorage for periods up to 24 hours
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an area in which vessels anchor or may anchor for periods of up to 24 hours.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: anchorage for pushing-navigation vessels
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an area where pushing-navigation vessels may anchor

DataDictionaryReference.Name: anchorage for other vessels than pushing-navigation vessels
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an area where other vessels than pushing-navigation vessels may anchor

DataDictionaryReference.Name: loading
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: A place where vessels may berth for loading cargo.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: unloading
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: A place where vessels may berth for unloading cargo.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: overnight accommodation
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: Berths that are suitable/ meant for berthing overnight.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: berth for pushing-navigation vessels
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an place where pushing-navigation vessels may berth.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: berth for other vessels than pushing-navigation vessels
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an place where other vessels than pushing-navigation vessels may berth.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: fleeting area
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: A legally permitted area in or near the waterway designated for temporary barge mooring.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: first class landing
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: A federally designated area that provides tie-ups and at least 9 feet (2.7m) of water depth during low water level.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: second class landing
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: A federally designated area that provides tie-ups and at least 9 feet (2.7m) of water depth normal pool level.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: diesel oil
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: diesel oil available

DataDictionaryReference.Name: water
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: water available

DataDictionaryReference.Name: ballast
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: ballast available

DataDictionaryReference.Name: power line
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a cable used for the supply of electricity.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: transmission line
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: multiple un-insulated cables usually supported by steel lattice towers. Such features are generally more prominent than normal power lines.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: telephone
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a cable used for the transmission of telephone signals.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: telegraph
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a cable used for the transmission of telegraph signals.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: mooring cable/chain
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a cable or chain used to secure a mooring buoy or other floating structure.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: ferry cable
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a cable where a cable ferry is connected to

DataDictionaryReference.Name: bulk
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: unpacked homogenous cargo poured loose in a certain space of a vessel e.g. oil or grain

DataDictionaryReference.Name: bulk
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: unpacked homogenous cargo poured loose in a certain space of a vessel e.g. oil or grain

DataDictionaryReference.Name: 0 small vessels and pleasure craft
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: designated for small vessels and pleasure crafts only

DataDictionaryReference.Name: I peniche
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: designated for barges of type "Pniche" (west of river Elbe) or of type "Gross Finow" (east of river Elbe)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: II campine barge
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: designated for barges of type "Kempenaar" (west of river Elbe) or of type "BM-500" (east of river Elbe)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: III Dortmund-Ems barge
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: designated for barges of type "Gustav Koenigs" (west of river Elbe) or of a similar type concerning the dimensions (east of river Elbe)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: IV Rhine-Herne barge
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: designated for barges of type "Johann Welker"

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Va Large Rhine barge; 1-barge push-tow unit
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: designated for barges of type "Large Rhine barge" or pushed convoys with one barge

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Vb 2-barge push-tow unit; long formation
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: designated for pushed convoys with two barges, long formation

DataDictionaryReference.Name: VIa 2-barge push-tow unit; wide formation
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: designated for pushed convoys with two barges, wide formation

DataDictionaryReference.Name: VIb 4-barge push-tow unit
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: designated for pushed convoys with four barges

DataDictionaryReference.Name: VIc 6-barge push-tow unit
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: designated for pushed convoys with six barges

DataDictionaryReference.Name: custom
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an office, especially in ports, at which customs dues are collected or administrated. (adapted from The New Shorter Oxford English Dictionary, 1993)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: border
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an office, at which immigration control takes place

DataDictionaryReference.Name: VTS centre
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The centre from which Vessel Traffic Services are operated. A VTS is a service implemented by a competent authority, designed to improve the safety and efficiency of vessel traffic and to protect the environment. The services should have the capability to interact with the traffic and to respond to traffic situations developing in the area.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: VTS sector
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The service area of a VTS centre.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: IVS point
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: A reporting point of the "Informatie en Volgsysteem voor de Scheepvaart" in the Netherlands.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: MID
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: A reporting point of the "Melde- und Informationssystem Binnenschifffahrt" in Germany.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: lock
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: A reporting point for vessels at a lock.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: bridge
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: A reporting point for vessels at a movable bridge.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: custom
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: A reporting point of the customs services for vessels.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: harbour
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: A reporting point of a harbour.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Lift-Lock
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: A lock of which the lock chamber itself is lifted vertically to level with the next waterway section

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Aqueduct
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: A structure (similar to the ancient aqueducts), for conveying a canal over a river or hollow; more properly called an aqueduct bridge. (From Webster's Revised Unabridged Dictionary, 1913)

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Sloping plane lock
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: A lock of which the lock chamber itself travels over a sloping plane to level with the next waterway section

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Water slope lock (Pente d'Eau)
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: In French "Pente d'Eau". A lock of which the lock chamber is formed by a sloping plane and moving gate, which is pushing a triangular section of water up along the slope to level with the next waterway section

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Other
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: other categories of an exceptional structure

DataDictionaryReference.Name: swinging wire ferry
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: ferry connected to a fixed point (e.g., an anchor in the middle of the waterway) and swings around this point from shore to shore via a cable to an anchor. The cable runs more or less parallel to the current

DataDictionaryReference.Name: custom harbour
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: A harbour that is administered by the customs. It may be a free harbour.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: port of refuge
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: A harbour that can be used to find shelter for bad environmental conditions or where efforts to mitigate larger damage or threat(s) of damage to either the vessel, her crew or the environment can be rendered.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: yacht harbour/marina
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a harbour with facilities for small boats and yachts (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 3095).

DataDictionaryReference.Name: fishing harbour
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a harbour with facilities for fishing boats.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: RoRo-terminal
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a terminal for roll-on roll-off ferries.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: ferry terminal
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a terminal for passenger and vehicle ferries.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: fishing harbour
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a harbour with facilities for fishing boats.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: naval base
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a centre of operations for naval vessels (adapted from The Collins Dictionary).

DataDictionaryReference.Name: tanker terminal
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a terminal for the bulk handling of liquid cargoes.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: passenger terminal
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a terminal for the loading and unloading of passengers.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: shipyard
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a place where ships are built or repaired (IHO Dictionary, S-32, 5th Edition, 4686).

DataDictionaryReference.Name: container terminal
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a terminal for container ships.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: bulk terminal
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a terminal for the handling of bulk materials such as iron ore, coal, etc.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: syncrolift
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a platform powered by synchronous electric motors used to lift vessels (larger than boats) in and out of the water.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: straddle carrier
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a wheeled vehicle designed to lift and carry containers or vessels within its own framework. It is used for moving, and sometimes stacking, shipping containers and vessels.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: service and repair
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a place where mechanical services or repairs can be undertaken to engines or other vessel equipment.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: quarantine station
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: A medical control center located in an isolated spot ashore where patients with contagious diseases from vessel in quarantine are taken.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: floating restaurant
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a permanently moored floating structure, such as an old ship, used as a restaurant.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: historic ship
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a ship of historical interest permanently moored as a tourist attraction.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: museum
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a permanently moored floating structure, such as an old ship, used as a museum.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: accommodation
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a permanently moored floating structure, such as an old ship, used for accommodation.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: floating breakwater
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a permanently moored floating structure, often constructed from old ships, used as a breakwater.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: casino boat
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a permanently moored floating structure, such as an old ship, used as a casino boat

DataDictionaryReference.Name: port-hand lateral mark
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: indicates the port boundary of a navigational channel or suggested route when proceeding in the 'conventional direction of buoyage'.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: starboard-hand lateral mark
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: indicates the starboard boundary of a navigational channel or suggested route when proceeding in the 'conventional direction of buoyage'.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: preferred channel to starboard lateral mark
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: at a point where a channel divides, when proceeding in the 'conventional direction of buoyage', the preferred channel (or primary route) is indicated by a modified port-hand lateral mark.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: preferred channel to port lateral mark
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: at a point where a channel divides, when proceeding in the 'conventional direction of buoyage', the preferred channel (or primary route) is indicated by a modified starboard-hand lateral mark.

DataDictionaryReference.Definition: indicates the left-hand side of the inland waterway

DataDictionaryReference.Name: bifurcation of the waterway
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: indicates a bifurcation of the inland waterway

DataDictionaryReference.Name: bifurcation of the channel
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: indicates a bifurcation of a channel of an inland waterway

DataDictionaryReference.Definition: indicates that the channel is near the right bank

DataDictionaryReference.Name: channel near the left bank
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: indicates that the channel is near the left bank

DataDictionaryReference.Name: channel cross-over to the right bank
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: indicates that the channel crosses from the left to the right bank

DataDictionaryReference.Name: channel cross-over to the left bank
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: indicates that the channel crosses from the right to the left bank

DataDictionaryReference.Name: obstruction at the left-hand side

DataDictionaryReference.Name: turn off at the left-hand side

DataDictionaryReference.Name: junction at the left-hand side

DataDictionaryReference.Name: (A.1a) closed area, but small craft boats without engine permitted (only RheinSchPV and Binnenvaatpolitiereglement)
(A.3) no overtaking of convoys by convoys

(A.7) no making fast to the bank

(A.10) no passing on right side (in openings of bridges or weirs)

(A.18) end of zone authorized for high speed navigation of small sport and pleasure craft prohibited
(A.19) no launching or beaching of vessels
(B.2a) move to the side of the channel on your port side
(B.2b) move to the side of the channel on your starboard side

(B.3b) keep on the side of the channel on your starboard side

(B.9b) do not cross the main waterway until certain that this will not oblige vessels proceeding on it to change their course or speed
(B.11) obligation to enter into a radiotelephone link on the channel as indicated on the board

(C.4) there are restrictions on navigation: make inquiries (with additional sign at bottom of main sign)

(C.5) the channel lies at a distance from the right bank
(D.1b) recommended channel only in the direction indicated, passage in the opposite direction prohibited (at bridges)

(D.2) you are recommended to keep on left side (in openings of bridges and weirs)
(D.3) you are recommended to proceed in the left direction
(D.3) you are recommended to proceed in the right direction
(E.5) berthing (i.e. no anchoring or making fast to the bank) permitted
(E.5.1) berthing permitted on the stretch of water of the breadth measured from, and shown on the board in meters
(E.5.2) berthing permitted on the stretch of water bounded by the distances measured from, and shown on the board in meters
(E.5.3) maximum number of vessels permitted to berth abreast

(E.5.6) berthing area reserved for pushing-navigation vessels that are required to carry two blue lights or two blue cones

(E.5.8) berthing area reserved for vessels other than pushing-navigation vessels that are not required to carry blue lights or blue cones
(E.5.9) berthing area reserved for vessels other than for pushing-navigation vessels that are required to carry one blue light or one blue cone
(E.5.10) berthing area reserved for vessels other than for pushing-navigation vessels that are required to carry two blue lights or two blue cones
(E.5.11) berthing area reserved for vessels other than for pushing-navigation vessels that are required to carry three blue lights or three blue cones
(E.5.12) berthing area reserved for all vessels that are not required to carry blue lights or blue cones
(E.5.13) berthing area reserved for all vessels that are required to carry one blue light or one blue cone
(E.5.14) berthing area reserved for all vessels that are required to carry two blue lights or two blue cones
(E.5.15) berthing area reserved for all vessels that are required to carry three blue lights or three blue cones
(E.6) anchoring or trailing of anchors, cables or chains permitted
(E.7) making fast to the bank permitted
(E.7.1) berthing area reserved for loading and unloading of vehicles
(E.9b) secondary waterway ahead on the right
(E.9c) secondary waterway ahead on the left
(E.9d) secondary waterway ahead, main waterway on the right
(E.9e) secondary waterway ahead, main waterwar on the left

(E.10f) junction with main waterway ahead and left, secondary waterway on the right

cargo residue/slop
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: A facility where vessels can dispose of cargo residues and/or slops.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: waste oil
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: A facility where vessels can dispose of waste oil.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: grey/black water
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: A facility where vessels can dispose of grey and/or black waste water.

DataDictionaryReference.Definition: A facility where vessels can dispose of domstic refuse.

DataDictionaryReference.Name: craft
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a vessel or item of floating equipment

DataDictionaryReference.Name: vessel
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an inland waterway vessel or sea going ship

DataDictionaryReference.Name: inland waterway vessel
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a vessel intended solely or mainly for navigation on inland waterways

DataDictionaryReference.Name: sea going ship
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a vessel certificated for sea-going service

DataDictionaryReference.Name: motor vessel
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a motor cargo vessel or a motor tanker

DataDictionaryReference.Name: motor tanker
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a vessel intended for the carriage of goods in fixed tanks and built to navigate independently under its own motive power

DataDictionaryReference.Name: motor cargo vessel
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a vessel, other than a motor tanker, intended for the carriage of goods and built to navigate independently under its own motive power

DataDictionaryReference.Name: canal barge
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: an inland waterway vessel not exceeding 38.5 m in length and 5.05 m in breadth and usu-ally operating on the Rhine-Rhne-Canal

DataDictionaryReference.Name: tug
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a vessel specially built to perform towing operations

DataDictionaryReference.Name: pusher
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a vessel specially built to propel a pushed convoy

DataDictionaryReference.Name: barge
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a dumb barge or tank barge

DataDictionaryReference.Name: tank barge
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a vessel intended for the carriage of goods in fixed tanks and built to be towed, either hav-ing no motive power of its own or having only sufficient motive power to perform restricted manoeuvres

DataDictionaryReference.Name: dumb barge
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a vessel, other than a tank barge, intended for the carriage of goods and built to be towed, either having no motive power of its own or having only sufficient motive power to perform restricted manoeuvres

DataDictionaryReference.Name: lighter
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a tank lighter, cargo lighter or ship borne lighter

DataDictionaryReference.Name: tank lighter
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a vessel intended for the carriage of goods in fixed tanks, built or specially modified to be pushed, either having no motive power of its own or having only sufficient motive power to perform restricted manoeuvres when not part of a pushed convoy

DataDictionaryReference.Name: cargo lighter
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a vessel, other than a tank lighter, intended for the carriage of goods and built or specially modified to be pushed, either having no motive power of its own or having only sufficient motive power to perform restricted manoeuvres when not part of a pushed convoy

DataDictionaryReference.Name: ship borne lighter
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a lighter built to be carried aboard sea going ships and to navigate on inland waterways

DataDictionaryReference.Name: passenger vessel
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a day trip or cabin vessel constructed and equipped to carry more than 12 passengers

DataDictionaryReference.Name: passenger sailing vessel
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a passenger vessel fitted out mainly with a view to propulsion under sail

DataDictionaryReference.Name: day trip vessel
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a passenger vessel without overnight passenger cabins

DataDictionaryReference.Name: cabin vessel
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a passenger vessel with overnight passenger cabins

DataDictionaryReference.Name: High-speed vessel
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a motorised vessel capable of reaching speeds over 40km/h with respect to water

DataDictionaryReference.Name: floating equipment
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a floating installation carrying working gear such as cranes, dredging equipment, pile drivers or elevators

DataDictionaryReference.Name: worksite craft
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a vessel, appropriately built and equipped for use at worksites, such as a reclamation barge, hopper or pontoon barge, pontoon or stone-dumping vessel

DataDictionaryReference.Name: recreational craft
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a vessel other than a passenger vessel, intended for sport or pleasure

DataDictionaryReference.Name: Dinghy
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a boat for use in transport, rescue, salvage and work duties

DataDictionaryReference.Name: floating establishment
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: any floating installation not normally intended to be moved, such as a swimming bath, dock, jetty or boathouse

DataDictionaryReference.Name: floating object
DataDictionaryReference.Definition: a raft or other structure, object or assembly capable of navigation, not being a vessel or floating equipment or establishment

DataDictionaryReference.Definition: Vehicle transfer location is suitable for car planks

DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The transfer of a vehicle requires permission.

DataDictionaryReference.Definition: The access to the public road is locked.

DataDictionaryReference.Definition: level indicator consisting of a calibrated staff/pole and the associated bench mark. (DIN 4049 Section 3, Oct. 1994)

DataDictionaryReference.Definition: analog or digital water level measuring and recording device. (adopted from DIN 4049 Section 3, Oct. 1994)

DataDictionaryReference.Definition: recording gauge providing information of the water level via a large external indicator (adopted from DIN 4049 Section 3, Oct. 1994)
